architectureStyle.description: Brutalist, oppressive, functional - designed for control, surveillance, and military efficiency
keyElements: Heavy concrete and metal construction - built to last and intimidate
Minimal windows - small, high, barred where present
Cobra/serpent head motifs echoing ship design
Ochre, brown, tan, gray colors - desert planet aesthetic
Surveillance towers and security checkpoints everywhere
Cardassian Union emblem (the stingray/manta shape) displayed
Angular, segmented architecture like insect exoskeletons
Interrogation facilities and holding cells integrated
Designed for occupation - controlling subject populations
NO comfort features, NO decoration except propaganda
Heat exchangers and environmental systems visible - Cardassia is hot
architectureStyle.colors: Ochre brown, tan, concrete gray, rust orange accents, yellow warning lights
architectureStyle.materials: Reinforced concrete, duranium plating, heat-resistant ceramics

buildings.name: Central Command
buildings.description: Military high command headquarters. Massive, imposing, the seat of Cardassian military power.

buildings.name: Obsidian Order Facility
buildings.description: Secret police headquarters. Appears as normal government building, hides interrogation chambers.

buildings.name: Prefect's Office
buildings.description: Colonial administrator building. From here, occupied worlds are controlled.

buildings.name: Detention Center
buildings.description: Prison facility. Infamous for harsh conditions. Labor camps, interrogation, execution.

buildings.name: Ore Processing Facility
buildings.description: Industrial building for processing mined resources. Uses forced labor.

buildings.name: Military Academy
buildings.description: Officer training facility. Discipline, tactics, loyalty to Cardassia above all.

buildings.name: Security Checkpoint
buildings.description: Controls movement between sectors. ID verification, searches, surveillance.

buildings.name: Garrison Headquarters
buildings.description: Military base for occupation troops. Barracks, armory, vehicle depot.

buildings.name: Communications Center
buildings.description: Controls all communications in the sector. Monitors, censors, intercepts.

buildings.name: Power Distribution Hub
buildings.description: Energy management facility. Can cut power to rebellious sectors.

buildings.name: Food Distribution Center
buildings.description: Controls food supply. Rations allocated based on cooperation with authorities.

buildings.name: Medical Facility
buildings.description: Hospital - but Cardassians get priority. Subject populations receive minimal care.

buildings.name: Weapons Factory
buildings.description: Manufacturing disruptors, phaser rifles, military equipment. Forced labor often used.

buildings.name: Shipyard Control
buildings.description: Administers ship construction. Overlooks orbital construction facilities.

buildings.name: Propaganda Ministry
buildings.description: Controls information, education, media. Rewrites history to favor Cardassia.

buildings.name: Labor Assignment Office
buildings.description: Assigns workers (often forced) to various projects. No one is unemployed in Cardassia.

buildings.name: Science Division
buildings.description: Research facility. Advanced technology development, often stolen from other races.

buildings.name: Embassy
buildings.description: Diplomatic facility. Even diplomacy is backed by threat of military force.

buildings.name: Trade Administration
buildings.description: Controls commerce. State-managed economy, everything monitored.

buildings.name: Tribunal Court
buildings.description: Justice facility - but verdicts are decided before trials begin. Show trials.

buildings.name: Family Registry
buildings.description: Tracks all citizens and their families. Used for leverage and control.

buildings.name: Defense Battery
buildings.description: Planetary defense installation. Spiral wave disruptors, targeting systems.

buildings.name: Residential Block
buildings.description: Housing for citizens. Uniform, monitored, minimal privacy.

buildings.name: Recreation Facility
buildings.description: State-approved entertainment. Kanar bars, holosuites with approved programs.
